proposal.title: Alexandria is LIVE!
proposal.description: More of a "sitrep" than a proposal, but we're using this do get more eyeballs :D

details.Text:
# Overview
As most of you know, this is a new chain. What this means for each part of the platform:

## Balances
The following balances was migrated:
  - all those associated with a membership `root` or `controller`
  - all tokens staked for Council Members and their voters, but as "free" balance
  - all tokens staked for (as "free" balance), and the balance of the "role" key of, active Content Curators and Storage Providers
  - all tokens staked for Proposals
  - all tokens staked for Validators and Nominators (although slashed tokens was deducted)
- The `Total Issuance` at the snapshot was: 154289593 tJOY
- The `Total Exported Issuance` was: 140539804 tJOY
- "Lost" tokens: 13749789 tJOY

If some of your tokens was "lost" in the transfer, users were/are able to "claim" until the end September 2020.


## Fiat Pool
- The fiat pool was "migrated" in full
- Recurring Replenishment will now be bi-weekly, in line with the Council Term

## KPIs and Tokenomics
- KPIs has been "overhauled".

Go [here](https://github.com/Joystream/helpdesk/tree/master/tokenomics) for more information.
More on KPIs

## Media
- All channels migrated
- All content migrated

## Memberships
All memberships migrated

## Working Groups

### Content Curators
- There are currently no Curators.
- If needed, `sudo` will perform curation before a new Council and Curator group is established

### Storage Providers
- We have set a "temporary" Storage Provider
- This is just to let users consume and upload Media before a new Council and Storage Working group is established

## Council
- We start without a Council
- The `Term` is now ~14 days (201,600 blocks), including:
   - `Announcing` ~2 days (28,800 blocks)
   - `Voting` ~1 day (14,400 blocks)
   - `Revealing` ~1 day (14,400 blocks)
- The Council Members (CMs) will earn 18,500tJOY/3600 blocks
- The CMs (and Voters) will share the Council KPIs
- The Council will earn more, but also have more responsibilites
- Jsgenesis will be a lot more involved in electing them

Go [here](https://github.com/Joystream/helpdesk/tree/master/roles/council-members) to learn more about the Council, and go [here](https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/categories/25) to announce your candidacy :)

## Proposals
- Proposals was not migrated, but historical proposals can still be found [here](https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/historical)

## Forum
- All posts/threads migrated
- Forum sudo re-instated in line with this [historical proposal](https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/historical/18)

## Validators
- Max slots increased to 20
- Max (yearly) inflation increased from 30% -> 75%
- Min (yearly) inflation increased from 2.5% -> 5%
- Magnitude of `slashes` decreased significantly
- We expect more stable software, so there should be fewer/less `slashes` due to node-malfunction
- Due to a change in reward calculations, the ROI should increase by a lot
- Validators need to claim their rewards manually

More info on Validating and Nominating can be found [here](https://github.com/Joystream/helpdesk/tree/master/roles/validators#rewards).

## Other
- The Overview/Tokenomics page is not yet deployed, but will be in a couple of days
- Council KPIs and Community Bounties will be published [here](https://www.joystream.org/testnet/) in good time before a Council has been elected.
- The [telegram](https://t.me/JoyStreamOfficial) bot is down, as it didn't survive the new [types](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@joystream/types)
- Things I've forgotten to address, will be added as comments :)

proposal.title: KPI 01.3 - Appoint new council secretary
proposal.description:
Hi, I would like to apply to be the council secretary, this is a role I did during the older testnet as well.

My tasks for this council round:
* With the new testnet there will be some reorganization of the community repo and placing of things in archive folders.
* Creating a thread for the discussion of community bounties (like the Telegram bot being fixed)
* Creating threads to discuss hiring new leads (this is one of the KPIs)
* Creating a thread to discuss the KPIs this round

My initial application from the old testnet: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/historical/55
Salary: 2 million tokens per council round (2 weeks)

I am Finny, a blockchain enthusiast, been here since the beginning of the new project. Looking forward to be an active member. \m\
I will fight against the corruption in the council! :D

I started in the field of Crypto in 2013 with GPU mining
I was active on bitcointalk for mining related queries, mainly helping out people there
I started getting into MNs in 2018
I am active on discord in a lot of servers now
This started as first seeking help and then giving back to the communities!
English is like my first language here
I was born and brought up in Delhi
I am 28 with 2 bachelors degrees (Law & Commerce) and a Master's in law, along with various Accounting certifications
I think it would be prudent to mention, that I have experience in managing events and leading groups
I have freelance experience in teaching MBA and grad students
I have also conducted various tax talks and seminars, including some related to crypto
I really enjoy working in this field
When I'm online, it doesn't feel like work to me
I'm extremely well versed in windows
But not linux
I have a static IP, my PC is on 24x 7
I'm running multiple MN's on my local machine
I'm part of the team who took over an exit scam, Armageddon coin
We have our own masternode hosting platform by the name of Millennium Club (MCLB) 
I'm also a Mod at another hosting platform, exchange (amongst other things) called Delion!
I've recently started dabbling in Linux via VPS as well, Joystream would be my first Validator on it!
I'm also running Mainnet Validator for Credits already (Win 10)

proposal.title: Hire Storage Lead
proposal.description:
This is to add an opening for the storage working group, we have discussed this on the forum: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/116?replyIdx=7 & https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/120?replyIdx=4

The agreed payment for this role is $40 per week (~764k tokens at current rate) and the lead will need to run their own storage node and hire at least 3 storage providers.

In your application, please explain why you are a good fit for this position and if you have any experience!

Requirements:
* Knowledge of how to operate a storage node and use the CLI (instructions are on Github: https://github.com/Joystream/helpdesk)
* Post HELIOS output twice per week on the forum

proposal.title: Curator Lead hiring and terms
proposal.description:
This is to signal agreement on the terms discussed by the community here: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/115 & https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/121

The terms are: $30 per week for the lead role, and $15 per week for worker payments. Currently there are not a lot of uploads, so this amount can be changed later if needed.

Unlike the storage role, the hiring process for the curator lead is managed by the creation of a "Set Lead" proposal, so as soon as there is an applicant that looks promising anyone is free to create a proposal for their hiring.

More information about this role: https://github.com/Joystream/helpdesk/tree/master/roles/content-curators

The thread for applying to this position: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/124


The thread for the previous curator lead hire: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/34
The thread for the previous curator rewards discussion: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/38

proposal.title: Error in reward interval for 1st council
proposal.description:
TL;DR 
When I set the initial reward params, I forgot that:

`council.firstPayoutAfterRewardCreated(): BlockNumber`
was relative to the when the council was elected - not when I set the recurring reward. That means council "missed" it's first 16 rewards:

For each:
16*18,500=296,000
Total:
6*296,000=1,776,000

(Note, it's fixed now, so the next council will get rewarded immidiately)

details.Text: I propose minting these tokens as sudo, and sending the CMs their just rewards :)

proposal.title: Fix storage lead reward payment
proposal.description:
During the proposal to hire the new storage lead, it looks like I accidentally set the payment amount slightly too high (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/10). The tokenomics page (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/tokenomics) says it is about $46.52 when it should be closer to $40, meaning the amount is about 15% too high. This proposal adjusts the amount paid per 3600 blocks to bring it down closer to $40.

The new amount to be paid would be 28200 tokens per 3600 blocks, which should equal to 789,600 tokens per week, at the current rate this is roughly $40 per week.

proposal.title: Increasing Validator Count
proposal.description:
This proposal is awesome because the waitlist now contains those validators who have already proven their willingness to work and validate blocks smoothly on the network.
Also, it will give the network more stability due to decentralization and reducing the risk of stopping nodes of a large proportion of validators from the total number.
The project needs reliable people who are ready to work well. Now they are waiting. I think it's time to take them to the main team!

proposal.title: Community Repo review request
proposal.description:
For KPI 01.5 the council secretary is required to make some changes and updates to the community repo (https://github.com/Joystream/community-repo). This proposal includes a list of new and outstanding changes that are required to be merged and acts as a request for Jsgenesis to review the current PRs. I'm fairly new to Github so hopefully there are no conflicts but I'm more than happy to resolve them if there are any issues.

### New files and changes:

* Add Tokenomics report template (https://github.com/Joystream/community-repo/pull/2)
* Add explanation of community bounty system (https://github.com/Joystream/community-repo/pull/27)
* Move all old council reports into an archive folder (https://github.com/Joystream/community-repo/pull/24)
* Updated submission log, bringing it up to date (https://github.com/Joystream/community-repo/pull/26)
* Add workinggroup-reports folder to readme (https://github.com/Joystream/community-repo/pull/16)
* Create initial template files for storage + curator evaluation (https://github.com/Joystream/community-repo/pull/15)

### Outstanding changes:

* Council report for council round #21 + #22 (https://github.com/Joystream/community-repo/pull/20) -- Already approved by council: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/88

### PRs that can be closed:

* https://github.com/Joystream/community-repo/pull/4

proposal.title: Validator count increase
proposal.description:
As part of the discussion [here](https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/125) and [here](https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/134) it is clear there is an increased demand for validator slots, there is also a requirement from one of our KPIs (KPI 02.4) to try and increase the total staked amount on the platform.

This proposal is to increase the validator count from the current value of 30 up to 35.
The last change was from 20 to 30 (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/12) and although rewards initially dropped by about 30%, the block rewards have increased from 5,595 JOY per era up to 7,586 JOY per era (an increase of 35%) probably due to the increased amount staked on the platform.

By opening up more validator slots, we will hopefully also see an increase in nominators putting stake behind validators which I hope would increase the total staked on the platform.

So that it is easier when considering future changes to validator count, here is the current information about validators and stake:

* total staked / total issuance: 20.953M / 159.275M (13%)
* validators / nominators: 37/21
* last reward: 7,588
* group earning: 1277031 JOY / week (from https://testnet.joystream.org/#/tokenomics)

proposal.title: Storage Provider Spot Check
proposal.description: KPI 02.5 requires the council to complete spot checks for roles on the platform, this is a spotcheck for the storage provider. It includes council requirements, payment information, HELIOS output and a conclusion.

details.Text:
### Storage Role Spot Check

This spot check was compiled on 18/10/2020 at 11:15 AM UTC

#### Council Requirements

When hiring the Storage Lead the Council agreed on certain requirements (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/4):

* Twice weekly HELIOS report on forums

- The Storage Lead has begun making these posts, there is only one so far as this started only recently: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/139?replyIdx=2

* Hire 3 providers (including lead)

- The Storage Lead has hired 3 providers (including lead). The Jsgenesis storage provider (joystream_storage_member) is also hired, but this provider is not paid so does not influence anything.

#### Payments
* No storage provider payments were agreed on by the council via proposal, but it was discussed on the forum as being $15 per week for each provider (the lead runs a provider but is not paid separately for this): https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/120?replyIdx=4

- The providers are currently paid 10,443 JOY/3600 blocks, at the current exchange rate ($0.0000505) this equals to $14.76 which appears to be an appropriate amount.

#### HELIOS output
```
Found 4 staked providers
== Live Providers
 [
  {
    providerId: 3,
    identity: 'QmRTVdhaoVqM8RNJKg7ySGoATV7pJ8iTB4EQ5bc1mRCbvD',
    expiresIn: 14360,
    expired: false
  },
  {
    providerId: 1,
    identity: 'Qma6vjPepCpCW4aKmNmPxCpgAsd8xWfqmzXj4pnjQUaEcj',
    expiresIn: 13953,
    expired: false
  },
  {
    providerId: 4,
    identity: 'QmZnvxStz7RrrNX1ivxAXVgMBpj9u4Mja1FjKo9UVXLDxH',
    expiresIn: 14313,
    expired: false
  },
  {
    providerId: 2,
    identity: 'QmaFBgVyAktkrVYajT3Yb4iFwQvimBm5jg648nZPxW4y1o',
    expiresIn: 14101,
    expired: false
  }
]
== Expired Providers
 []

== Down Providers!
 []

Resolving live provider API Endpoints...
4 -> https://computt.com/storage/
3 -> https://joystreamnode1.cloudstorey.in/storage/
2 -> https://tpd111.me/
1 -> https://rome-node-6.joystream.org/

Checking API Endpoints are online
https://rome-node-6.joystream.org/ - OK
https://computt.com/storage/ - Request failed with status code 404
https://tpd111.me/ - OK
https://joystreamnode1.cloudstorey.in/storage/ - Request failed with status code 404
```

(Data directory output was removed because of length)

```

provider 1: has 114 out of 114
provider 2: has 114 out of 114
provider 4: has 0 out of 114
provider 3: has 0 out of 114
Done in 98.26s.
```

#### Conclusions
* This role took a long time to become live, this can be seen as both a combination of the council taking time to complete the hiring process, as well as the software being changed
* 3 out of 3 hired storage providers (providers `2`, `3` and `4`) are not currently serving content
- `Provider 2` returns `ERR_FAILED`
- `Provider 3` returns `404`
- `Provider 4` returns `404`

proposal.title: Content Curator Role Spot Check
proposal.description: KPI 02.5 requires the council to complete spot checks for roles on the platform, this is a spotcheck for the curator role. Unlike the storage role, this involves less technical information so is mainly composed of my own judgement and including links, It includes council requirements, curator requirements, a curator role review, payment information, and a conclusion.

details.Text:
### Curator Role Spot Check

This spot check was completed on 18/10/2020 at 12:33 PM UTC

#### Council Requirements

* When hiring the Curator lead the council did not specify any requirements.

#### Curator Requirements

* The current curator requirements are outlined here: https://github.com/Joystream/helpdesk/tree/master/roles/content-curators#content

#### Curator Role Review

* The previous moderation actions (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/54) seem to show that content on the network has been effectively curated, but there aren't enough uploads to say whether this is being done currently.
* The curation policy seems to be clear and I wasn't able to locate any complaints regarding it: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/53
* The Requests and Reports thread shows there have been no requests or reports made at this time: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/52
* Featured videos: At this time there are several featured videos, which seem to be a decent collection given the low amount of uploads.
* Unplayable content: At this time I was not able to locate any files which were unplayable on Joystream.
* Metadata accuracy: At a glance, most videos seem to have accurate metadata, one example of incorrect metadata was found in the `first released` field on this video, this is a minor issue: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/media/videos/949
* Verified channels: It does not appear there are any channels that require being verified at this stage, the only channel I could find would be the `Joystream Official` channel which has not been verified so far: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/media/channels/34 I could not find any record of this being requested so its not important.
* Censored and closed channels: I was unable to find any channels or users violating the rules.

#### Payments

* The Curator Lead should self manage their budget, at this time the Curator Lead has opted to not recieve payments (this was communicated on Telegram)
* The Curator Lead is still in the process of hiring a Curator Worker (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/working-groups/opportunities/curators). The rewards for this are stated as `13923 JOY PER 3600 BLOCKS` which would equal to $19.68 at the current exchange rate of $0.0000505. This is above the $15 the council had agreed to by about 30% (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/5) but given the curator lead is currently not taking payments, it is inconsequential. 

#### Conclusion

* Most of the work done by the Curator Role was completed in the previous testnet, there have not been enough uploads to show whether the role is being effectively run but overall it appears that it is being done fine right now.

proposal.title: KPI 02.6 - Potential Bounties
proposal.description: As part of KPI 02.6 the council is tasked with presenting a list of potential community bounties that would be of value for the project. I created a thread (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/135) for this and these are what people submitted.

details.Text:
* @freakstatic_council

- Would be good to have something like council performance report or member statistics page, so that we can check how active is someone before vote on them.
- To help with the council spotchecks would be good to have something to collect information about the curator performance

* @tomato
- (For the forum) A block countdown tool. A user should select a block number, put it in some formatted embed type such as :countdown:#98004931: and the forum would be able to render this to users as a human readable countdown to 
that particular block, such as Block #98004931 (3d, 14h, 27m remaining). This could be a valuable tool for forum threads announcing events and runtime upgrades and give users a much better indication of when events will happen.
- (For the forum) Another would be a way of having block heights have a timecode that shows on mouse hover action, the user would input a block such as :block:#36234194: and when a user does a mouseover they would get a localized timecode shown in their browser (ex. 14/09/2021, 06:13 AM
- A tip bot for the Telegram channel. This could either be an upgrade to the previous bot, or be a separate bot.
- Some way to capture historic exchange rate from https://status.joystream.org/status so that users can determine the exchange rate at a given blockheight and also have charts showing the exchange rate.
- An API documentation. Not sure how would be the best way to do this, but new users interested in completing bounties have had lots of questions about the API and since there is no documentation about it all, it may be worthwhile to have this available in some form.

proposal.title: Proposed budget adjustment
proposal.description:
As part of KPI 02.5 the council has to have a budget that takes into account the weekly replenishment of the platform, this is currently set to $300 per week and with our current budget we are using over $2 of this amount (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/136?replyIdx=8)

We can't adjust council payments, and we cannot adjust the amount validators are paid. Validator payments depend on how much stake is on the platform and this amount has been continuously increasing resulting in the validator rewards being higher than what they were initially. So the only things possible to adjust are working group payments.

details.Text:
In order to bring the budget down, I am proposing that the following changes are made:
* The storage lead rewards are changed from $40 per week to $35 per week
* The curator lead rewards are changed from $30 per week to $20 per week

These adjustments would make the budget go from -$2 to +$13.
If this proposal is approved, I would create a proposal to adjust the storage lead rewards and there is no proposal needed to adjust the curator lead rewards as they self manage this through their own budget of tokens.

proposal.title: Rolling Updates for Community Repo
proposal.description:
The (community repo)[https://github.com/Joystream/community-repo] contains submissions from the community in the form of documentation, reports and also code contributions for things like the Telegram bot. There are some documents that require periodic updates like a submission log.

Currently there is no agreed on way to about doing updates to previous projects or work on the community repo: https://github.com/Joystream/community-repo#revisions--improvements-of-submissions

There was a forum thread discussing this here: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/102

This proposal's description adds a potential method of dealing with it, which if approved I'll add to the community repo readme.

details.Text:
- for general updates (updating links, text) these can just be gathered occasionally and submitted as a rolling update like this example: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/14 This does mean that it will take some time for the PRs to be approved by the council.
- in the event of some highly important change, a proposal could be made so that the matter is addressed more quickly than waiting for a rolling update
- if users want to be paid for updates or corrections, then they should open a PR (or multiple PRs) and link to it in a spending proposal, when this is approved it would have the same effect as approving the PR (which still has to be reviewed by Jsgenesis)
- as an example, if a user wants to add functionality to the telegram bot and be paid for it, they can open a PR and create a spending proposal linking to the PR

Each rolling update should include a breakdown (like a changelog) of each pull request and it would be up to the council to look at the changes and decide to approve or not. If the updates have code, then it may take the council more time than is available to review, so the submitter will have to consider how long the proposal will be open for before expiring. For now there hasn't bee much use of this, but it will be something to consider for the future when there may be far more complicated code updates.

This would hopefully help to ensure there are not too many proposals submitted or a situation where proposals are submitted for very minor corrections.

details.Text:
### Storage Role Spot Check

* 18/10/2020 - https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/22

- The Storage Lead has mostly kept to making these update posts: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/139?replyIdx=2

* Hire 3 providers (including lead)

- The Storage Lead has hired 3 providers (including lead). The Jsgenesis storage provider (joystream_storage_member) is also hired, but this provider is not paid so does not influence anything.

#### Payments
* No storage provider payments were agreed on by the council via proposal, but it was discussed on the forum as being $15 per week for each provider (the lead runs a provider but is not paid separately for this): https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/120?replyIdx=4

- The providers are currently paid 10,443 JOY/3600 blocks, at the current exchange rate ($0.0000505) this equals to $14.28 which appears to be an appropriate amount.

* Lead payments are managed directly by the council, so can't be judged.

#### Mint Status

#### User Facing check
The user facing check is a simple check to see that this role is working from a user perspective, for this role that means if videos are loading as expected.

* As a user, I was able to load 8 videos without issues from the following nodes. Loading and skipping seemed to work fine and the speed seemed good:

* https://computt.com/storage/asset/v0/5DTVY5BZgf8C4ALMAEXPAU6yDzruZia89QVR8t9U93XrHJ7P

#### Conclusions
* During the previous spot check for this role, no nodes were working properly, this was due to a documentation error with Caddy. This has been resolved and appears to be rectified.
* It appears the storage role is being managed effectively, HELIOS reports are being posted, the mint is being filled, and all storage nodes appear to be active and working.
* From a user perspective, content looks to be loading quickly and working as it should.

proposal.title: Content Curator Role Spot Check
proposal.description: KPI 03.5 requires the council to complete spot checks for roles on the platform, this is a spotcheck for the curator role. Unlike the storage role, this involves less technical information so is mainly composed of my own judgement and including links, It includes council requirements, curator requirements, a curator role review, payment information, mint status and a conclusion.

details.Text:
### Curator Role Spot Check

This spot check was completed on 01/11/2020 at about 11:30 AM UTC at blockheight ~#581,381

#### Previous Reports

* 18/10/2020 - https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/23

#### Council Requirements

* When hiring the Curator lead the council did not specify any requirements.

#### Curator Requirements

* The current curator requirements are outlined here: https://github.com/Joystream/helpdesk/tree/master/roles/content-curators#content

#### Curator Role 

* Since the last report was submitted, a curator worker has been hired as required.

* Since the last report was submitted, there have only been 2 uploads. Neither of these appear to have any moderation issues, however one of the videos is currently unplayable (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/media/videos/957)

#### Payments

* The Curator Lead should self manage their budget, at this time the Curator Lead has opted to not recieve payments (this was communicated on Telegram)

* The Curator Lead has hired a worker as required.

* The Curator Lead is currently paid `13923 JOY / 3600 blocks` This equals to about $18.92 per week. Which is slightly below the $20 the council had agreed to in the last budget by about -5.39% (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/25)

* The Content Curator are currently paid `13923 JOY / 3600 blocks`. This equals to about $18.92 per week which is slightly above the $15 the council had agreed to by about 26% (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/5)

* Overall the budget of the entire role (lead + workers) equals to about $37.84. The agreed budget is $35 so this is not a significant difference given the fluctuation of the token value.

* The Curator role does not currently work the same as the storage role, meaning workers have to be fired and rehired to adjust budgets (this was communicated by the lead via Telegram). This is a current system limitation which means it is difficult to adjust the budget.

#### Mint Status

* The Curator mint currently contains `220,312` JOY. There doesn't seem to be any issues with mint capacity.

#### Conclusion

* There haven't been a significant enough number of uploads to make any conclusions regarding this role.
* The management of payments could be improved upon, but there are currently system limitations that make this more difficult than with other roles. The differences between agreed and current payments aren't significant.

proposal.title: Proposed budget adjustment
proposal.description:
As part of KPI 03.5 the council has to have a budget that takes into account the weekly replenishment of the platform, this is currently set to $300 per week and with our current budget we are using $297.71 (only leaving $2) of this amount (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/143)

We can't adjust council payments, and we cannot adjust the amount validators are paid easily as these both require runtime upgrades. Validator payments depend on how much stake is on the platform and this amount has been continuously increasing resulting in the validator rewards being higher than what they were initially.

The only options are to:
* reduce the validator count, but considering validator payments help to devalue the token, I do not think this would be the best strategy at this point.
* make adjustments to agreed payments for roles on the platform

I think we can make a minor adjustment to the payments for the storage role (as the curator role requires firing and rehiring all workers to adjust payments) and I have put what I propose in the description. This is not a huge adjustment but would hopefully just allow a bit of breathing room.

It is important to note that the budget that I post in the forum deals with agreed and actual payments. Since we agree on payments for roles in USD mostly, some of the actual payments are higher/lower than they should be just because of the exchange rate changing. For example, the storage lead has an `agreed payment` of `$35 per week`, but this is currently an `actual payment` of `$35 per week`.

We can't control the exchange rate of the token, but we can change on what we agree certain values are in the budget which has to continuously be reviewed. At times because of the exchange rate changing (because tokens are minted, burned or the dollar pool value changes) this will always lead to some adjustments being required.

The proposed changes should bring the `agreed budget` from the councils side down from `$297 per week` to `$293 per week`.

If this proposal is approved I will create a proposal changing the storage lead reward, and also ask the storage lead to adjust payments to match the budget.

details.Text:
In order to bring the `agreed budget` down slightly, I am proposing that the following changes are made:
* The storage lead rewards are changed from $35 per week to $33 per week. The actual current payments are $34 per week due to the token exchange rate.
* The storage worker rewards are changed from $15 per week to $14 per week. The actual current payments are $14.22 per week due to the token exchange rate.

These changes should bring the `agreed budget` from the councils side down from `$297 per week` to `$293 per week`.

posts.text:
I approve this changes but we really should think about cutting the slots for the validators, since this should increase the reward of each validator, right?
As reported in Telegram it seems that validators are not getting enough tokens to compensate for the cost of the servers, which will increase in the future, with the chain size increasing.
On top of this is a role which is a bit difficult to control the payments, since it depends in the amount in stake.

@freakstatic I think this is because a lot of validators don't have a large amount of stake, so it is easy for a nominator to put backing behind the validator which reduces the validator's rewards a lot. You can see this on the targets page, where the ratio of `own stake` : `total stake` is as high as 1:10.

proposal.title: KPI 03.6 - Suggested community bounties
proposal.description: As part of KPI 03.6 the council needs to submit a list of suggested community bounties. These bounty ideas were contributed on this forum thread: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/144

details.Text:
@freakstatic
* I think that having the bot report about messages in the proposal would be good, since now that messages can be missed.
* Another good feature would be a reminder if one proposal is taking too long to be voted.
* A tool to benchmark the average, minimum and maximum bandwidth of the storage providers should also be good to understand the quality of the storage providers.
* Maybe the bot could report if some storage provider is down?

@tomato
* I think having the Telegram bot include functionality which can respond to user commands would be nice. This could answer stuff like how long until the next election. Or how many active proposals there are.
* Another nice function for the Telegram bot might be to automatically send a notification when mints reach a certain low level (say 150k tokens).
* A small bounty for someone to create a thread on the forums that collects a bunch of free / open source tools for video conversion
* A script (or improvement of the current validator page) which goes through the past n eras and breaks down how much each validator and nominator made, puts out ratios and helps to better explain what each validator is actually earning.
* A small bounty for doing a review of storage provider and validator costs. The person doing it should put together what the current hardware requirements of each are (primarily the storage space, CPU cores and RAM requirements which they can ask current people doing these roles for) and a list of 5-10 different providers, and how much each charges.

proposal.title: Assign community bounty 3
proposal.description:
As part of KPI 03.6 the council is required to assign the bounty for `Improve Telegram Bot(s)` to someone. I would like to propose that this work is assigned to @l1dev as they just completed the recent Typescript update of the Telegram bot. Although there are a few minor bugs still remaining with the bot, it is quite a steep learning curve for new members of the community to understand how the platform works and hopefully with additional work we can have an improved bot.

Notes:
* Currently, we do not know what the specific requirements of this bounty are or what they will pay, so once that information is released it would be up to @l1dev to accept them or not.
* The council still has to judge the work completed whenever that may happen, this is just a proposal to assign the work.

proposal.title: Alexandria KPI 05.5 - Proposed Budget
proposal.description:
As part of KPI 05.5 the council has to agree on a budget taking into consideration the weekly replenishment of the platform, inflation rate and other factors.

* Our current agreed budget shows we are exceeding replenishment by $19 per week (or 6.51%).

* There have been lots of token withdrawals which has resulted in the validator stake amount hitting 24% meaning the current validator rewards are at an all time high.

* It is difficult for the Curator working group to reduce rewards as it does not operate like a normal working group, this is being changed in the next testnet.

* On the previous budget we already reduced some of the payments for working groups quite a lot: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/36

Budget thread: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/152

details.Text:
I propose that we keep the existing budget for now (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/36) there have been many changes with tokenomics so reducing working group rewards even further will be difficult when the validator rewards are at almost their limit. In the next council session we could maybe look at changing other rewards but I think we need to see how validator rewards change or stabilize for a little while before taking action. The reason for this is that if Validator + Nominator stake reaches 25% the reward payouts will be significantly penalized and it should be expected that validators will self-manage how much they are staking to avoid being penalized for staking too much. It isn't possible to predict how this will happen because this is the first time the stake has reached such a high amount.

Although we are exceeding the weekly replenishment amount of $300 by $19 this is not a huge amount and to reduce enough to be lower than $300 would require cutting $19 from the budget of the working + curator groups and I'm not sure its possible to reduce them further just yet.

proposal.title: KPI 05.5 - Storage Role Spot Check
proposal.description: KPI 05.5 requires the council to complete spot checks for roles on the platform, this is a spotcheck for the storage provider. It includes council requirements, payment and mint information, HELIOS output, user-facing check and a conclusion.

details.Text:
### Storage Role Spot Check

This spot check was compiled on 02/12/2020 at about 1:00 PM UTC (blockheight ~#1,019,597)

#### Previous Reports
* 18/10/2020 - https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/22
* 01/11/2020 - https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/33

#### Council Requirements

When hiring the Storage Lead the Council agreed on certain requirements (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/4):

* Twice weekly HELIOS report on forums

- The Storage Lead has mostly kept to making these update posts: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/139?replyIdx=2

* Hire 3 providers (including lead)

- The Storage Lead has hired 3 providers (including lead).

#### Payments
* No storage provider payments were agreed on by the council via proposal, but it was discussed on the forum as being $15 per week for each provider (the lead runs a provider but is not paid separately for this): https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/120?replyIdx=4

- The providers are currently paid 10,443 JOY/3600 blocks, at the current exchange rate ($0.0000471) this equals to $13.77 which appears to be an appropriate amount.

* Lead payments are managed directly by the council, so can't be judged.

#### Mint Status

* Storage Mint capacity at block #1,019,733 is `830,830`. So far there have been no situations where the mint has been empty, so this seems ok.

#### HELIOS output
```
Found 3 staked providers

== Live Providers
 [
  {
    providerId: 3,
    identity: 'QmRTVdhaoVqM8RNJKg7ySGoATV7pJ8iTB4EQ5bc1mRCbvD',
    expiresIn: 13932,
    expired: false
  },
  {
    providerId: 2,
    identity: 'QmaFBgVyAktkrVYajT3Yb4iFwQvimBm5jg648nZPxW4y1o',
    expiresIn: 14011,
    expired: false
  }
]

== Expired Providers
 [
  {
    providerId: 4,
    identity: 'QmZnvxStz7RrrNX1ivxAXVgMBpj9u4Mja1FjKo9UVXLDxH',
    expiresIn: -13532,
    expired: true
  }
]

== Down Providers!
 []

Resolving live provider API Endpoints...
3 -> https://joystreamnode1.cloudstorey.in/storage
2 -> https://tpd111.me/storage

Checking API Endpoints are online
https://tpd111.me/storage - OK
https://joystreamnode1.cloudstorey.in/storage - OK

Data Directory has 123 assets
```

(Data directory is removed due to lenghth, it showed 3/3 replication on all content)

```
Checking available assets on providers (this can take some time)...
provider 2: has 123 out of 123
provider 3: has 123 out of 123
Done in 120.43s.
```


#### User perspective check
This tests whether the role is working from the perspective of a Joystream user.

* Video load failures (ERR_CONECTION_TIMED_OUT)
	* https://computt.com/storage/asset/v0/5GPhGYaGumtdpFYowMHY15hsdZVZUyEUe2trgh2vq7zGcFKx
	* https://computt.com/storage/asset/v0/5FBA8yAaKJFLBv17ioCcK7pYqytQqghWVUY57TNMDzaCYBK3
* Video load success
	* https://joystreamnode1.cloudstorey.in/storage/asset/v0/5GPhGYaGumtdpFYowMHY15hsdZVZUyEUe2trgh2vq7zGcFKx
	* https://joystreamnode1.cloudstorey.in/storage/asset/v0/5FBA8yAaKJFLBv17ioCcK7pYqytQqghWVUY57TNMDzaCYBK3
	* https://tpd111.me/storage/asset/v0/5HE3SUGEVeRqS7YQ1Sw8SWByUCcn4JVeR5reAkeajAnTurBQ
	* https://tpd111.me/storage/asset/v0/5DrzGzSbn9PmVQxskREbi7xnqhawu6TTmAiywrzsfmp6fEt9
	* https://joystreamnode1.cloudstorey.in/storage/asset/v0/5CGYQYAyN78opDxL2dUYDV1ufDK9zDkhDU7UfRRaFEjEoXmq
	* https://joystreamnode1.cloudstorey.in/storage/asset/v0/5DTVY5BZgf8C4ALMAEXPAU6yDzruZia89QVR8t9U93XrHJ7P
	* https://joystreamnode1.cloudstorey.in/storage/asset/v0/5FBA8yAaKJFLBv17ioCcK7pYqytQqghWVUY57TNMDzaCYBK3
	* https://tpd111.me/storage/asset/v0/5HUQtZk5YPDwYaHJK4WqK6GmxRopFYLjeQbSYniHunQWAwTA
	* https://tpd111.me/storage/asset/v0/5D3naphUGSgbWMnpcDnmYvz4rp9FFEtjTjyJxQgrb8HouiDg


#### Conclusions
* It appears the storage role is being managed effectively, HELIOS reports are being posted, the mint is being filled, and all storage nodes appear to be active and working.
* From a user perspective, content looks to be loading quickly and working as it should.
* One provider is down/expired and has been down for approximately 22 hours. This does not seem like an excessive amount of time.

proposal.title: Content Curator Role Spot Check
proposal.description: KPI 05.5 requires the council to complete spot checks for roles on the platform, this is a spotcheck for the curator role. Unlike the storage role, this involves less technical information so is mainly composed of my own judgement and including links, It includes council requirements, curator requirements, a curator role review, payment information, mint status and a conclusion.

details.Text:
### Curator Role Spot Check

This spot check was completed on 02/12/2020 at about 1:20 PM UTC at blockheight ~#1,019,802

#### Previous Reports

* 18/10/2020 - https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/23
* 01/11/2020 - https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/34

#### Council Requirements

* When hiring the Curator lead the council did not specify any requirements.

#### Curator Requirements

* The current curator requirements are outlined here: https://github.com/Joystream/helpdesk/tree/master/roles/content-curators#content

#### Curator Role 

* Since the last report was submitted, there haven't been many uploads. None of these appear to have any moderation issues, however one of the videos is currently unplayable (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/media/videos/957)
* I wasn't able to locate any videos that were violating the rules and couldn't find any complaints made by users.

#### Payments

* The Curator Lead should self manage their budget

* The Curator Lead has hired a worker as required.

* The Curator Lead is currently paid `13923 JOY / 3600 blocks` This equals to about $18.36 per week. Which is slightly below the $14 the council had agreed to in the last budget (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/56)

* The Content Curators are currently paid `13923 JOY / 3600 blocks`. This equals to about $18.36 per week which is slightly above the $14 the council had agreed in the last budget (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/56)

* Overall the budget of the entire role (lead + workers) equals to about $36.72. The agreed budget is $28 so this is a bit above.

* The Curator role does not currently work the same as the storage role, meaning workers have to be fired and rehired to adjust budgets (this was communicated by the lead via Telegram). This is a current system limitation which means it is difficult to adjust the budget.

#### Mint Status

* The Curator mint currently contains `443,080` JOY. There doesn't seem to be any issues with mint capacity.

#### Conclusion

* There haven't been a significant enough number of uploads to make any conclusions regarding this role.
* The management of payments could be improved upon, but there are currently system limitations that make this more difficult than with other roles. The differences between agreed and current payments aren't significant.
* The curator working group helped to compile a list of content for transferring to the new system: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/151?replyIdx=15

- collect council info ($150)
- summarize proposals ($250)
- create dedicated stats website ($350)

proposal.title: A bounty for creating an ext stats site
proposal.description:
## Intro
An external stats website is described in this github issue: https://github.com/Joystream/community-repo/issues/50
Part of the work for this has already been done: https://joystreamstats.live/
This bounty was partially described here: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/63

This is also similar to the landing page concept for Pioneer for which there are several github issues:
* https://github.com/Joystream/joystream/issues/485

## Examples
* The Joystream homepage has `Testnet Metrics` which shows interesting data about the platform: https://www.joystream.org/

* The tokenomics page on Pioneer: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/tokenomics

* Siacoin has a stats site: https://siastats.info/ 

## The Problem
Part of the problem with the current UI (Pioneer) is that it is difficult to change, and there are some things that won't be possible until later on. Pioneer 2.0 is in development but this will take time to be launched.

The council does do council and tokenomics reports but since these are issued only twice a month they do not communicate trends very well.

Keeping track of active proposals and using the current UI is fairly time consuming, we do have a Telegram bot but there is no way to look at things from a 'live' perspective.

On top of improving things for current users of the platform, this stats page would also hopefully be a valuable resource to show new users the level of activity on the platform.

## The goal
The goal of this bounty is to create a simple stats website that can be built upon incrementally. The stats website already shows valuable information, for example
* showing the number of hours each active proposal has left (which can be seen by hovering over the proposal)

* letting users click active proposals and be taken directly to the proposal in question

* showing validators member names (which helps to show who is running validators)

* showing this and other information all on one single page and not requiring a user to go through different parts of Pioneer

An external stats website would run on top of a node and go through chain data to provide data in two ways:
* Live data (ex. issuance, active proposals)

* Parsed data (ex. old council sessions, historical issuance, historical mint levels)

An external stats website could be a valuable tool for a number of reasons including but not limited to:
* Explaining tokenomics and value of the platform

* Better clarifying how much nominators and validators are paid (currently Pioneer UI only shows how much an entire validator gets and there is no explanation of nominator payments)

* Surfacing active proposals

* Providing statistics on proposal types and other interesting information. Explaining to users how many proposals there are and how quickly the council works is a very valuable item to communicate.

* Surfacing recent forum threads and posts that are very active

* Showing trends in storage capacity

details.Text:
If this proposal is approved, the person doing the bounty would need to set up a PR on the community repo (https://github.com/Joystream/community-repo) with the GPL-3.0 license, which will allow others to contribute and improve upon it.

This initial proposal is aimed at having a bounty to create a basics statistics website, over time the council could add more bounties for more features.

I propose that this bounty is split into the following milestones:
1. set up initial website (domain and the current UI). This would be https://joystreamstats.live as is. - $250 US

2. show basic historical tokenomics data (total issuance, burned amount, mints minted values) with some graphs so a user can see trends over time - $125 US

3. show proposal statistics (average time to finalize, how much historic spending proposals are worth with a graph, number of proposals submitted with a graph etc) - $125 US

This is not an official bounty, which means that any spending proposals paid out would come from the fiat pool (currently valued at $9746.68). If Jsgenesis decides to make it an official bounty, then it would fall under the Jsgenesis bounty system described here: https://github.com/Joystream/helpdesk/tree/master/roles/builders#community-bounties

Currently the hosting costs are covered by @tomato, but later on this can be addressed with spending proposals. The ownership of the domain itself is not being covered by this proposal, domain ownership is something we will have to work out later.

proposal.title: Alexandria KPI 06.5 - Proposed Budget
proposal.description:
As part of KPI 06.5 the council has to agree on a budget taking into consideration the weekly replenishment of the platform, inflation rate and other factors.

* Our current agreed budget shows we are exceeding replenishment by $31.25 per week (or 10.42%).

* Validator stake and rewards are the highest they have ever been, currently validator rewards are 2901180 (or 8.04% higher than in the previous council term when they were between 2305075-2685140 JOY/week)

Budget thread: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/159

details.Text:
I propose we maintain the same budget as discussed here (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/36). We also took the same action in the last council session: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/56

Some reasoning:
* KPI and bounty rewards are added to the KPI pool besides the weekly replenishment, it doesn't appear that all of these rewards or even payments for roles are frequently removed. This does allow us some buffer with the budget.

* Although we are exceeding the weekly replenishment, it is not by a substantial amount.

* Validator rewards are at a very high rate, but at the same time validators seem to be starting to remove stake in order to keep the total staked amount below 25%. I think it will require some time to see how this balances out as nominators also have some effect on this part of the platform.

* It is difficult for the Curator working group to reduce rewards as it does not operate like a normal working group, this is being changed in the next testnet which is launching quite soon.

* Given the current token valuation, the currently paid amounts are in some cases lower than what we have agreed. So reducing payments further would only help if we were to substantially reduce the budget. The current budget for working groups (curators + storage providers) is $74. In order to reduce this amount and fit it within the weekly replenishment it would have to be almost reduced in half, this is probably not sustainable if we want to keep the roles filled.

proposal.title: Content Curator Role Spot Check
proposal.description: KPI 06.5 requires the council to complete spot checks for roles on the platform, this is a spotcheck for the curator role. Unlike the storage role, this involves less technical information so is mainly composed of my own judgement and including links, It includes council requirements, curator requirements, a curator role review, payment information, mint status and a conclusion.

details.Text:
### Curator Role Spot Check

This spot check was completed on 15/12/2020 at about 4:30 PM UTC at blockheight ~#1,207,326

#### Previous Reports

* 18/10/2020 - https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/23
* 01/11/2020 - https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/34
* 02/12/2020 - https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/58

#### Council Requirements

* When hiring the Curator lead the council did not specify any requirements.

#### Curator Requirements

* The current curator requirements are outlined here: https://github.com/Joystream/helpdesk/tree/master/roles/content-curators#content

#### Curator Role 

* Since the last report was submitted, there haven't been many uploads.
* One of the recent uploads appears to be a brief section of a popular movie, I'm not sure if this falls under fair use or not: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/media/videos/971
* I couldn't find any complaints made by users on Telegram chat or on the forum.

#### Payments

* The Curator Lead should self manage their budget

* The Curator Lead has hired a worker as required.

* The Curator Lead is currently paid `13923 JOY / 3600 blocks` This equals to about $18.20 per week which is slightly above the $14 the council had agreed to in the last budget (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/56)

* The Content Curators are currently paid `13923 JOY / 3600 blocks`. This equals to about $18.20 per week which is slightly above the $14 the council had agreed in the last budget (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/56)

* Overall the budget of the entire role (lead + workers) equals to about $36.4. The agreed budget is $28 so this is a bit above.

* The Curator role does not currently work the same as the storage role, meaning workers have to be fired and rehired to adjust budgets (this was communicated by the lead via Telegram). This is a current system limitation which means it is difficult to adjust the budget. In the next testnet this will change and the curator lead role will be managed in the same way the storage lead role is currently managed, meaning the council can create proposals to adjust the rewards for the lead and the lead themselves can manage payments to workers much more easily.

#### Mint Status

* The Curator mint currently contains `554464` JOY. There doesn't seem to be any issues with mint capacity.

#### Conclusion

* There haven't been a significant enough number of uploads to make any conclusions regarding this role.
* The management of payments could be improved upon, but there are currently system limitations that make this more difficult than with other roles. The differences between agreed and current payments aren't significant.

details.Text:
### Storage Role Spot Check

This spot check was compiled on 15/12/2020 at about 5:00 PM UTC (blockheight ~#1,207,538)

#### Previous Reports
* 18/10/2020 - https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/22
* 01/11/2020 - https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/33
* 02/12/2020 - https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/57

#### Council Requirements

When hiring the Storage Lead the Council agreed on certain requirements (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/4):

* Twice weekly HELIOS report on forums

- The Storage Lead has mostly kept to making these update posts: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/139?replyIdx=2

* Hire 3 providers (including lead)

- The Storage Lead has hired 3 providers (including lead).

#### Payments
* No storage provider payments were agreed on by the council via proposal, but it was discussed on the forum as being $15 per week for each provider (the lead runs a provider but is not paid separately for this): https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/120?replyIdx=4

- The providers are currently paid `10,443 JOY/3600 blocks`, at the current exchange rate ($0.0000467) this equals to $13.65 which appears to be an appropriate amount.

* Lead payments are managed directly by the council, so can't be judged.

#### Mint Status

* Storage Mint capacity at block #1,207,563 is `3,376,218`. So far there have been no situations where the mint has been empty, so this seems ok.

#### HELIOS output
HELIOS is a tool on the Joystream repo which can be used to check the status of storage providers and content replication: https://github.com/Joystream/joystream/tree/master/storage-node/packages/helios


#### User perspective check
This tests whether the role is working from the perspective of a Joystream user.
`Video load success` means the video was briefly loaded, playback was skipped ahead and there were no problems with the content.

* Video load success

#### Conclusions

proposal.title: Upgrade Runtime to Babylon
proposal.description:
We are now ready to upgrade the testnet to Babylon!

The major changes of this release are:
- A shiny new UI to consume video content
- A new content directory
- Both are powered by the Query Node - Hydra
- The curators will now fully be a working group, working exactly like the storage working group
- New CLI features

We are very excited about this release, as we can finally unveil our user facing product to consume media. Although this is just the first release, we hope it will showcase our ambitions to more casual users. More info will follow in the blogs and newsletters later this week.

Finally, after we have gotten this approved, we may ask for permission to skip the grace period and perform the upgrade during the weekend to coincide with the change of the Council.

proposal.title: JoystreamStats.live (Part II+III)
proposal.description:
I did my best to deliver work outlined in proposal 68 however some data is not available to achieve all listed outcomes.

- Part I: DONE and REWARDED with proposal 71
> I propose that this bounty is split into the following milestones: 1. set up initial website (domain and the current UI). This would be https://joystreamstats.live as is. - $250 US


- Part II:

> show basic historical tokenomics data (total issuance, burned amount, mints minted values) with some graphs so a user can see trends over time - $125 US

The link below shows basic tokenomics like total issuance, burned amount and a graph for burned tokens over time. Additionally it features a browser for council reports hosted on github. On a separate page all votes for previous proposals are listed and broken down by council member and round:

https://joystreamstats.live/councils

The proposals asks for the presentation of historic data. If this cannot be found on-chain or other sources hosted by Jsgeneses this task cannot be achieved without setting up a backend including a database. As mentioned in #50 in the future this might be delivered by a `query-node` in development, however the schedule and feature set at this point is vague.

To determine the `total mint` the sum of all rewards needs to be calculated: council, storage, curators, validators. This is not a trivial task and code relevant to this is layered in multiple files.
As the proposal mentions this data is available in pioneer but cannot be easily edited to customize views. Additionally for previous rounds, historic data needs to be available. For future rounds this can be done by setting up a hosted stats server to serve this data to the frontend. I would like to ask the council to create a proposal describing the wanted outcome in a bit more detail including a realistic cost estimate.


- Part III:

> show proposal statistics (average time to finalize,

This information including visualized voting time for all proposals is available here:

https://joystreamstats.live/proposals

> how much historic spending proposals are worth with a graph, number of proposals submitted with a graph etc) - $125 US

This information appears not to be accessible from the chain. Please give a hint where to retrieve this information from. If it is neccessary to decode the onchain code of spending proposals, please give a hint how this can be done.

- Source Code

The source code is available on GH. A PR with the full source code and instructions to run the website will opened on approval. It includes type-safe components that can be reused independently. Please note that maintaining and refactoring code in the future requires time and should be considered in price calculations.

proposal.title: Raise Validator Count
proposal.description:
Currently we have 35 validators and 18 nominators. A validator makes about $17 a month which more than pays for a VPS capable of running a validator.
More than half of all validators have extremely high commission rates (90% or more), this means there being a nominator is not an attractive role, since these high commission validators will not pay out any tokens to nominators or pay a very small amount.
I've made this proposal to increase the number of validators to 42, as this will hopefully make being a validator or nominator more competitive.

proposal.title: KPI 07.5 - Budget
proposal.description:
As part of KPI 07.5 the council has to agree on a budget.
The budget thread is here: 
https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/171

Currently weekly replenishment is $300
We have `agreed` to spend $323.60 per week
We are `currently` spending $289.42 per week (as the curator role has not been filled yet)

details.Text:
Given the requirements of the curator lead + workers have changed significantly with the testnet upgrade, I would like to propose the following changes:

|                      |     Quantity |     Agreed Total |     Suggested Change    |
|----------------------|--------------|------------------|-------------------------|
|     Storage Lead     |     1        |     $32          |        $25              |
|     Storage Provider |     2        |     $28          |        $28              |
|     Curator Lead     |     1        |     $14          |        $25              |
|     Curator Worker   |     1        |     $14          |        $16              |
|                      |              |                  |                         |
|     Subtotal         |              |     $88          |        $94              |
|                      |              |                  |                         |

This would bring our `agreed budget` from $324.43 per week up to $330.43 per week, which would make our budget about 10% higher than the weekly replenishment.

A few notes:

* The new curator lead and role will require a more technical knowledge and usage of the CLI (https://github.com/Joystream/helpdesk/tree/master/roles/content-curator-lead)
* It was very difficult for the old curator lead to manage payments, or for the council to manage the lead curator's payments due to system limitations, this has been resolved which means the council can now create proposals to adjust the lead curator's payments very easily and the curator lead can manage their own budget much more easily.
* Validator payments are again a record high amount, in the previous budget (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/159) they were 2901180 JOY/week, now they are at 3190405/week. This is an increase of ~10% from the last council term. The Validators and Nominators are self-managing and the council can't easily influence how much they make on the platform.
* The token value is quite lower (0.0000437) compared to previous councils (0.0000475 - 0.0000518) (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/152)
* Council Member payments are around $16-17 per week, on top of this they are paid a bonus for achieving KPIs, you can see the previous council payouts in this document: https://github.com/Joystream/community-repo/blob/master/council-reports/alexandria-testnet/Alexandria-Council-Leaderboard.md
* The council has issued 72 million tokens since Alexandria was launched (this is through spending proposals as well as council member payments)
* A large amount of tokens have been redeemed for money, as can be seen in this chart (https://joystreamstats.live/tokenomics). Although burning does not directly affect the token valuation, it indirectly influences the amount of stake validators have and subsequently how much they make as well as in other small ways.

I will not be on the next council, so if this proposal is rejected or isn't approved by then a new council member should create the appropriate proposals to make this budget active.

proposal.title: Storage Role Spot Check
proposal.description: There is no current KPI requirement to complete a storage spot check, so this is just a spot check for the sake of doing a spot check. This report includes council requirements, payment and mint information, HELIOS output, user-facing check and a conclusion.

details.Text:
### Storage Role Spot Check

This spot check was compiled on 30/12/2020 at about 4:00 PM UTC (blockheight ~#1,420,766)

#### Previous Reports
* 18/10/2020 - https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/22
* 01/11/2020 - https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/33
* 02/12/2020 - https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/57
* 15/12/2020 - https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/73

#### Council Requirements

When hiring the Storage Lead the Council agreed on certain requirements (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/4):

* Twice weekly HELIOS report on forums

- The Storage Lead has mostly kept to making these update posts: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/139?replyIdx=2

* Hire 3 providers (including lead)

- The Storage Lead has hired 3 providers (including lead).

#### Payments
* No storage provider payments were agreed on by the council via proposal, but it was discussed on the forum as being $15 per week for each provider (the lead runs a provider but is not paid separately for this): https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/120?replyIdx=4

- The providers are currently paid `10,443 JOY/3600 blocks`, at the current exchange rate ($0.0000467) this equals to $12.77 which appears to be an appropriate amount although is slightly lower than agreed.

* Lead payments are managed directly by the council, so can't be judged.

#### Mint Status

* Storage Mint capacity at block #1,420,780 is `743,058`. So far there have been no situations where the mint has been empty, so this seems ok.

#### HELIOS output
HELIOS is a tool on the Joystream repo which can be used to check the status of storage providers and content replication: https://github.com/Joystream/joystream/tree/master/storage-node/packages/helios

```
Found 3 staked providers

== Live Providers
 [
  {
    providerId: 3,
    identity: 'QmRTVdhaoVqM8RNJKg7ySGoATV7pJ8iTB4EQ5bc1mRCbvD',
    expiresIn: 14150,
    expired: false
  },
  {
    providerId: 4,
    identity: 'QmZnvxStz7RrrNX1ivxAXVgMBpj9u4Mja1FjKo9UVXLDxH',
    expiresIn: 14046,
    expired: false
  },
  {
    providerId: 2,
    identity: 'QmaFBgVyAktkrVYajT3Yb4iFwQvimBm5jg648nZPxW4y1o',
    expiresIn: 14171,
    expired: false
  }
]

== Expired Providers
 []

== Down Providers!
 []

Resolving live provider API Endpoints...
4 -> https://computt.com/storage/
3 -> https://joystreamnode1.cloudstorey.in/storage
2 -> https://tpd111.me/storage

Checking API Endpoints are online
https://computt.com/storage/ - OK
https://tpd111.me/storage - OK
https://joystreamnode1.cloudstorey.in/storage - OK
```

(Data directory is removed due to length, it showed 3/3 replication on all content)

```
Checking available assets on providers (this can take some time)...
provider 3: has 425 out of 425
provider 4: has 425 out of 425
provider 2: has 425 out of 425
Done in 357.44s.
```


#### User perspective check
This tests whether the role is working from the perspective of a Joystream user.
`Video load success` means the video was briefly loaded, playback was skipped ahead and there were no problems with the content.

(Atlas does not currently load videos from the storage nodes directly due to some technical issue so cannot be judged)


#### Conclusions
* It appears the storage role is being managed effectively, HELIOS reports are being posted, the mint is being filled, and all storage nodes appear to be active and working.
* It is not possible to judge this role for a user perspective due to a technical issue.

proposal.title: Reversal of Proposal 101
proposal.description:
See description for background and our proposed solution.

---

As a significant member of the community, we believe [l1dev](https://testnet.joystream.org/#/members/l1dev) when they claim this was an accident. It would however break the trust between Jsgenesis and the rest of the community if the tokens was left on the (wrong) account and then later moved.

Feel free to discuss alternatives if this is not approved!

details.Text:
In proposal [101](https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/101), a spending request was made by member [l1dev](https://testnet.joystream.org/#/members/l1dev), and approved by the council.
In proposal [105](https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/105), said member claimed to have injected the wrong destination account for this proposal. Unfortunately, no one in Jsgenesis reacted to this in time (proposals can only be vetoed by sudo during the `grace `) period.

The actual recipient was `5EUUcgTb6dngyVfFHkU4qvqqCaiavgNzncPnnb8WsNdspJZT`, an account that has not made a single extrinsic (nonce is 0) on the platform, as can by confirmed  either by adding the account as a contact, or:
`chain state -> system -> account(5EUUcgTb6dngyVfFHkU4qvqqCaiavgNzncPnnb8WsNdspJZT)`

There are some ways to resolve this, but Jsgenesis proposes the following:

1. Member [l1dev](https://testnet.joystream.org/#/members/l1dev) creates a new spending proposal, for the same amount.
2. Jsgenesis uses the sudo key to burn the 5M tokens held by `5EUUcgTb6dngyVfFHkU4qvqqCaiavgNzncPnnb8WsNdspJZT`.
3. Jsgenesis increases the council mint by 5M tokens.

We will note that 2. this is a rather extreme approach. On the one hand, we would not approve of this if the account had been used. On the other hand, this ensures that it can't be a double spend.

There was a sybil attack on a previous election which meant that anyone who applied for the council with less than 95k JOY as stake was not considered in the election process. I've increased this number from 25 to 40 which might help to improve it.

proposal.description:

details.Text: The defunct provider is to be replaced with at least one opening for another storage provider to keep the number at a minimum of three.

proposer.about: https://joystreamstats.live/members/l1dev

member.about: https://joystreamstats.live/members/l1dev

posts.text:
Turned out the provider is not offline but the reports are wrong. The underlying issue is that the storage provider`s DNS settings cause issues resolving the domain depending on location where requests are issued from.

Currently TTL is set to 1s which breaks DNS caching. This setting is very low and can only be useful when transferring a domain. For normal operation however it should be raised to at least 1 minute or better several hours.

Withdrawing the proposal.

proposal.title: Adjust Runtime Parameters
proposal.description:
After increasing validator count from 45 to 80, reward dropped from 500 to 300 tJOY per validator hour (40%). Recently more nodes rushed into the game waiting to become validators, with currently more than 300 nodes and above 50 on the waiting list.

If the goal is to correct rewards to 500 tJOY per validatour hour (~15$/m), max_inflation: 1_500_000 would be sufficient for currently 90 slots at current issuance:
310 M tJOY * 1.2 / (24*365.24) / 90 * 24*30 * 45.1 $ / M tJOY = 14.8 $.

However during the last days node count more than tripled (from below 80 to >300). It is hard to predict correct numbers until the end of this term but 150 slots would be enough for today. Accounting for an increase of issued tokens by 10M during the next two weeks, `max_inflation: 2_000_000` assures constant rewards:
320 M tJOY * 2 / (24*365.24) / 150 * 24*30 * 45.1 $ / M tJOY = 15.8 $

It is beyond the scope of this proposal to predict or limit growth of slots. Generally two parameters influence payout: amount issued and maximum inflation rate. At an inflation rate of 2 daily 1.7 M tokens are added (310 * (1 + 2 / (365.24))), or 14.6 M (9.8%) in two weeks (310 * (1 + 2 / (365.24)) **14).
To increase opportunities without risking lower rewards in the future it should be discussed, if instead of adjusting inflation rate keeping slot growth in line with existing inflation of 10% per two weeks is enough.

To leave some wiggle room for the council to adjust validator count in the future I propose `max_piece_count: 500`. However actual payout is still limited by the budget set by the council which is limited by the platform budget set by jsgenesis.

Ideal stake is increased to allow for higher nominations since recently 25% are topped regularly. With 30% additional 16 M more can be staked.

After approval a PR is to be created adjusting above parameters:
- https://github.com/Joystream/joystream/blob/master/runtime/src/lib.rs#L289

For reference see:
- https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/204
- https://github.com/Joystream/community-repo/blob/master/community-contributions/miscellaneous_reports/Increase%20Validator%20Set%20Research.md

Please correct if any calculations are incorrect.

details.Text:
Adjust Runtime Parameters
- min_inflation: 0_050_000,
- max_inflation: 2_000_000,
- ideal_stake: 0_300_000,
- falloff: 0_050_000,
- max_piece_count: 500,
- test_precision: 0_005_000

This proposes to change following parameters:
- max_inflation: 2_000_000
- ideal_stake: 0_300_000
- max_piece_count: 500

proposal.title: JoystreamStats development (weeks 4-6)
proposal.description:
This is a re-submission of proposal 132 which three approvals got reset due to council election.

In weeks 4 to 6 of 2021 following improvements for the stats website has been / is being worked on:

- redesign the frontpage to show a better overview (#84)
- add a navigation bar to all components (#84)
- add modals for details on members and validators
- add support for channels and existing media
- collect info on amount of spending proposals (#82)
- improved validator overview answering questions listed in (#63)
- new reward chart to show development over time (#84)
- add backend to cache data and reduce burden on the frontend
The results become visible once the new version is released. The currently planned release date is end of February 2021.

Some members of the community offered to contribute and are rewarded by me directly.

Relevant code will be released via PR to the community-repo.

All referenced issues can be found here: https://github.com/Joystream/community-repo/issues

proposal.title: Runtime Upgrade Proposal
proposal.description:
With the inflow of new users, there are lots of urgent matters that needs to be addressed.

This text proposal will only address those can, and need to be, solved by a runtime upgrade. In particular, it aims to allow more users to participate on the network, and improve capacities where needed.

details.Text:
The full details are too long to fit in the description, but full details can be found in [this issue](https://github.com/Joystream/community-repo/issues/105). Please note that this is for discussion only as of now, whereas an actual proposal will be made as soon as we have gotten some input.

TL;DR
- Allow the council more freedom in setting the Max Validator count, and number of Council Members
- Leave Validator rewards untouched, despite possible increases in Validators effectively lowering the individual rewards, to make it less likely that "whales" will occupy multiple slots
- Increase Unbonding time (for Validators), so that slashing of Validators becomes more of a threat
- Increase the number of active proposals allowed at the same time
- Increase the required stakes for proposals to avoid this remaining an issue

Looking forward to see what the community thinks of this!

proposer.about: Joystream Project Admins

member.about: Joystream user. Interested in decentralized projects, governance systems and more user friendly technology.
I am Finny, a blockchain enthusiast, been here since the beginning of the new project. Looking forward to be an active member. \m\
Joystream is awesome!
I will fight against the corruption in the council! :D

posts.text: I can't see any issues with the changes suggested. The only thing is validator rewards, which would ideally allow the role to be profitable but given the token price keeps increasing and validator rewards always increase I kind of get the feeling that any change may be too unpredictable at this moment.

author.about: Joystream user. Interested in decentralized projects, governance systems and more user friendly technology.

posts.text:
I hesitate to approve this.
- validator count: this looks fine, however it ignores approved proposal 140 https://github.com/Joystream/joystream/pull/2184
- leaving validator rewards untouched doesn`t seem to solve the proclaimed issue of whales occupying slots. TBD KPI 11.4
- Increasing unbonding time to 1 month or a week: As long as bonded assets can`t be used for voting this seems unfavorable. If there`s elevated interest to slash validators this should be explained more.
- Increasing proposal slots sounds like a good choice. As council member i see no issue handling 10 or 25 proposals at the same time. Being able to have multiple proposals on the same topic without fearing to block other proposals should increase the council`s ability to decide between offered options.
- Increasing stakes for text and spending proposals by 100% makes it harder for new contributors. So far there was no issue with too many proposals, rather a lack of clarity about the process for some bounties.

author.about: https://joystreamstats.live/members/l1dev

posts.text:
Thanks for your feedback both of you.
I think the two main points of contention is:
1. How to fix the current "mess" with validators
2. How to balance the need for opening proposals, with the cost of following up on them.

Due to space constraints again, I will reply in the issue!

(FYI, would be nice if this was shared on the forum/discord as well)

author.about: Joystream Project Admins

proposal.title: Creating RUS guides on reporting
proposal.description:
Hi Everyone! 

There has been some amount of questions in the Russian-speaking community on how to create reports on contributions and submit them via the project website.
So I see it important to fulfill the following tasks: 

1. Create a text guide (with screenshots) on preparing the report
2. Create a text guide (with screenshots) on submitting the report
3. Create a how-to video on submitting the report 

In fact, before receiving 25k JOY for submitting this proposal, I already performed task 1 (https://link.medium.com/WC60pvjU6db) and 2 (https://link.medium.com/JLlNVhWU6db)

So the remaining task is the video on submitting the report. I set the deadline to 26.02.2021.
